summary: How did older people or those with disabilities fare immediately after Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria? Emergency managers and others told us it was sometimes difficult to locate these survivors and provide the help many needed to find food, medicine, and oxygen. Further, FEMA's application for assistance contained disability questions that were easily misinterpreted. This may have led to fewer people reporting their disabilities—making it...
title: Disaster Assistance: FEMA Action Needed to Better Support Individuals Who Are Older or Have Disabilities
